text: Aroma: green apple, molasses, lively get citrus, sweet scents, molasses. Appearance: clear, dark gold, no head. Taste: medium sweet. Palate: some sours coming up quickly, citric acid, green apple. Overall: nice Ice Cider, very refreshing. Bottle from Middle Farm, Lewes.

Bottle from Middle Farm. It pours clear golden orange with good lacing on the glass. The nose is soft, juicy, sweet apple, spice, toasty sugar, golden syrup and fresh apple pie. The taste is crisp, juicy apple, light mouth-pucker, pleasant spicy aspect, apricot, dried mango, pear skin, apple pie, honey and light alcohol warmth with a lingering oily fruits. Medium-full body and slick, oily mouth-feel. Pretty frickin delicious. Nice tart edge to it. Crazy drinkable as well.

Bottle @ Three Counties Cider Shop, Ledbury. A startlingly bright and colourful blend and my first sip of ice cider. Ripe, mushy apple flesh give way to thick, deeply fruity complexities before a smooth honey warmth settles things down. Very interesting, each sip opening up new colours to the palette with a real sharp clarity. Exceptional.

375ml bottle, 2013 Xmas present from Sarah & Jonny. Clear orangey yellow golden colour, no head and sweet syrupy fresh apple aroma. Very sweet apple taste with alittle tartness and buttery, honey & caramel notes. Smooth slightly oily mouthfeel, medium bodied, low carbonation, sweet & dry but clean finish. Lots of complexity in the flavour, very sippable ice cider.

Bottle at Chrisos Pre-GBBF Shindig, 2012, London. Pours clear yellow with a few small bubbles. Plenty of ripe apples in the nose. Big sweet flavor, nicely rounded, not too boozy, some mild spice. Full bodied with soft carbonation. Rich and sweet to finish, thick, lightly chewy, warm apples, subtle honey. Wonderful ice cider. Huge thanks to the fellow who brought this along - apologies for not remembering!

Bottle at Chrisos Pre-GBBF Shindig 2012. A clear golden amber colour with no head once poured. Sweet apples, a delicate tang, spice, vanilla & honey. Really sweet but maintains its structure. Doesnt linger overly so on the palate. Quite crisp & fresh despite the intensity of the sweetness. Drinkable, really almost too much so. Medium body, soft mouthfeel with a modest lingering finish. Fantastic with good complexity.

Goldeny amber colour, no head. Aroma is sweet applejam, some honey, mild vanilla and mild alcohol as well. Flavour is sweet apple juice, honey, mild nectar and some slight vanillaish notes. Sweet, but very pleasant to drink. Lovely stuff!

Bottle sample at Chrisos pre-GBBF Shindig 2012. Colour is clear deep amber. Nose is intense sweet apple, white sugar, honey. taste is intense sweet juicy fresh apple. Exquisite apple flavour, some sweet sugary light honey. But mainly its the apple that hits you. Need to get some more of this.
sample at Chrisos Pre-GBF tasting. yellow pour, delicious stuff, sweet apples, full creamy mouthfeel. explodes with flavor. very impressive

Bottle @ Chrisos Pre-GBBF Shindig. The pours deep golden with no head. The nose is strong concentrated apples and some spun sugar. THe taste is much the same, plenty of strong sweet apple flavors. Very sweet, but unbelieveably smooth. Quite easy to drink. Medium body, soft carbonation. Overall, this is my first experience with an ice cider. Very interesting, I look forward to trying more!
Smagt hos J & C. Smag af madæble, flot gul og rolig, meget sød, rigtig lækker, mellem fylde, cremet og blød, dejlig.

Bottle 375ml. @ UK-SCO Tasting in Ulfborg.[ Courtesy of Fin ]. Clear medium yellow orange color with virtually none head. Aroma is moderate to heavy apples, floury apple, red apple, fruity - honey notes. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and light light acidic with a long duration, very concentrated apple, dry dry finish. Body is medium to full, texture is oily, carbonation is flat. Lovely ice cider and then only a 7% ice cider. >;O) [20110409]

Bottle at Jan & Charlottes tasting, Ulfborg, Denmark 09.04.11 cheers Jan & Charlotte   Pours gold with excellent clarity. Very sweet but for once the sweetness doesnt detract as there is so much complexity here and there is some dryness. Really easy drinking , full flavoured very concentrated explosion of juicy apples, some honey and rich ripe juicy sweet apples, marvellous. This is stunning, a few stray bubbles pop too the surface, I could drink more of this quite easily. Great stuff again from Dragon Orchard.  A8 A5 T9 P4 Ov17  4.3
Bottle @ J & Cs, Ulfborg. Thanks. Pours clear golden with no head. Lovely complex nose. Fresh red apples, a bit of oak, good deal of tartness. Sticky and sweet. A bit of vanilla. Very nice sipper..

bottle at jans ... golden yellow ... sweet cooking apple nose ... sharp tangy apple front ... light viscous body... not as viscous as expected ... juicy sweet apples ...light honeyish ... light dry tanin linger ... de de de de de lisious
